alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 15 at 3:36AM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND RIO GRANDE VALLEY THURSDAY... .A cold front will bring low humidity and gusty northwest winds by Thursday morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid spread of wildfires. Conditions will improve rapidly after sunset Thursday with diminishing winds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND RIO GRANDE VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds, cured fuels, and low relative humidity values, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, Coastal Kenedy, Northern Hidalgo, Coastal Willacy and Coastal Cameron. * TIMING...9 AM TO 6 PM. * WINDS...North 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 15 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * LIGHTNING...Very low chance. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
